links.quantification: 30% canopy mandate → 53 cities plant 50M trees → ₹20K Cr green infrastructure investment → urban ecosystems restored
Tree canopy → 3-5°C urban cooling + PM2.5 filtration (20kg/tree/year) → ₹10K Cr health/energy benefits annually
Green infrastructure → stormwater runoff -40% → urban flooding reduction → ₹8K Cr disaster damage avoided
Nature access → mental health improves +30% → ₹5K Cr health savings + property values +15% near green spaces
Land scarcity: 30% canopy needs 150K ha in 53 cities → real estate opportunity cost ₹50K Cr → developer resistance
Cooling → AC demand reduction → energy savings → less fossil generation → air quality improves further (reinforcing)
Requires native species mandate: Biodiversity benefits only with indigenous trees → exotic species ban + nursery capacity prerequisite
Via groundwater: Tree root zones → aquifer recharge +20% → city water security improves → ₹3K Cr supply savings
Via cooling: 5°C temperature reduction → heat-related deaths -40% → vulnerable community resilience improves
Via stewardship: Community park engagement → tree survival +50% → urban forest sustainability improves
